name: Baked Tilapia Veracruz with Brown Rice (Mild)
description: Family-friendly Veracruz-style tilapia baked in a tomato, pepper, and olive sauce. Serve over brown rice with a squeeze of lime for a mild Latin comfort dinner.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 1/2 cups brown rice under cold water.
Peel and thinly slice 1 large onions.
Pat dry 4 tilapia fillets and season both sides with salt and black pepper.
cook_steps: Add 3 cups water and the rinsed brown rice to a pot with a pinch of salt; bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until tender, 35–40 minutes. Keep covered off heat.
Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add onions and bell peppers; cook, stirring, until softened, 6–8 minutes.
Stir in garlic; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add 1 can diced tomatoes (about 400 g), sliced olives, 1 bay leaves, 1 teaspoon oregano, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Simmer 5 minutes to meld.
Nestle the seasoned tilapia into the sauce in a single layer. Spoon some sauce over the top.
Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake until the fish flakes easily with a fork, 12–15 minutes (thickness may vary).
Remove bay leaves. Squeeze the juice of 1/2 lime over the fish and sauce. Adjust salt and black pepper to taste.
Fluff the brown rice. Serve fish and sauce over rice. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons chopped parsley and offer remaining lime wedges.
